thread.title: jets into LA after testifying
thread.title_full: Kim Kardashian jets into LA after testifying | Daily Mail Online

author: Christine Rendon For Dailymail.com
title: jets into LA after testifying
text:
Kim Kardashian returned home to Los Angeles with her family on Friday, after reportedly spending a grueling 10 hours testifying before French authorities in her Paris robbery case in New York City.
The reality star, 36, had her son Saint West, one, in her arms as she walked outside of the private jet behind her sister Khloe and daughter North West at an airport in Van Nuys.
Khloe, 32, held her niece's hand as she walked downstairs in a camouflage print jacket, black shirt, and sunglasses.
Home sweet home: Kim Kardashian, her sister Khloe Kardashian, and her children Saint and North West returned to Los Angeles on Friday
Kim followed behind wearing a plush coat and a black hat over her long straight hair.
Saint clung to his mother, clad in a grey onesie, as his older sister North stepped out wearing a black top, track pants, and carrying a pink doll.
Upon reaching the tarmac, Khloe flashed a smile as she strode around in her impressive black heels.
Even after a long flight home from New York, the reality star appeared in good spirits.
Doting aunt: Khloe held her niece's hand as she carefully followed her behind
It has likely been a grueling time lately for Kim, who has spent the last few days testifying before a French judge in her robbery case in New York City.
Friday was set to be the last day of testimony for Kim, according to TMZ .
The entrepreneur and her attorneys flew to the Big Apple to give testimony to a French judge on Wednesday, which included watching security footage from that night in order to try and identify the armed men.
Hitting her stride! Upon reaching the tarmac, Khloe flashed a smile as she strode around in her impressive black heels
She met with the judge and attorneys involved in the multi-million jewelry heist case behind closed doors in New York on Wednesday, TMZ reports.
Part of her testimony involved watching footage of the robbery to try and identify the two armed men who broke into her Paris apartment in October and terrorized her.
The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star is said to have met with officials for 10 hours on Thursday, according to E! .
Tough: It has likely been a grueling time lately for Kim, who has spent the last few days testifying before a French judge in her robbery case in New York City
Last October, Kim was robbed of millions of dollars worth of jewelry at gunpoint inside a Paris hotel.
During the heist, the star was gagged and bound by the robbers before they ran off with her jewelry - including her $4 million diamond ring given to her by Kanye.
Under French crime laws, victims don't have to face the offenders in court with judges allowed to travel elsewhere to obtain a testimony in private.
Seventeen alleged veteran armed robbers - aged mostly between 50 and 72 - were arrested last month in relation to the jewelry heist and police charged 10 of them.
Hand in hand: Khloe carefully followed after her niece, who clung to her plush toy
Two of the suspects - the only ones Kim will be able to identify - are accused of breaking into the reality TV star's Paris apartment block and tying her and a security guard up at gunpoint.
They fled with her $4 million 20-carat emerald cut diamond engagement ring and a case of her other jewelry.
Kim flew out of Paris within hours of her ordeal.
'They have a lot of evidence thatâ€™s not out there in the media,' a source told Us Weekly , adding that Kim was 'happy justice is going to be served.'
Kim broke her silence in a teaser trailer for her family's reality TV show last month telling two of her sisters her thoughts at the time: 'They're going to shoot me in the back. There's no way out.'
All good: Even after a long flight home from New York, the reality star appeared in good spirits.
